intro: Mammillaria boelderliana, commonly known as the Boelderliana Pincushion Cactus, is a small, spineless cactus native to Mexico. It features a globular stem with a dense covering of white, woolly hairs that help reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its grayish-green body. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its compact size and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
